summary: The International Maritime Pollution Accountability Act of 2025 aims to reduce pollution from the shipping industry. It mandates the EPA to assess fees on covered voyages based on lifecycle CO2-e emissions and emissions of criteria air pollutants. Revenue generated will fund programs for decarbonizing the Jones Act fleet, research and development of low-carbon fuels and technologies, workforce development, harbor craft and ferry electrification, increased air monitoring in port communities, and existing clean air and ocean programs.
